springboard_purpose: Help organizations quickly discern which practitioners align with their values/approach
extraction_context: These questions extract practitioner information for organizational decision-making, NOT for building a social platform

questions.question: How does the speaker describe their approach to practicing presence with clients or communities?
questions.purpose: Help orgs discern depth of engagement vs surface-level work
questions.notes: Distinguishes 'stops fully to listen' from 'quick check-ins'
questions.example_answer: I take time to stop fully and hear what lies beneath someone's usual answer
questions.source_value_card: Rukudzo - True Presence Beyond Medical Distance

questions.question: What does the speaker say about sustaining their practice when emotions or circumstances shift?
questions.purpose: Identify practitioners who work beyond emotional ups/downs
questions.example_answer: I ground my commitment in what's possible rather than in fluctuating emotions like hope or despair

questions.question: What specific methods or techniques does the speaker teach or use in their work?
questions.purpose: Provide concrete approaches orgs can evaluate
questions.notes: Barry's 'half-step back from empathy' - actionable techniques
questions.example_answer: I teach the half-step back from empathy to maintain perspective while keeping the heart open

questions.question: How does the speaker describe attending to power dynamics, structural constraints, or systemic factors?
questions.purpose: Surface practitioner awareness of context beyond individual
questions.notes: Rukudzo's economic/social constraints on mental health
questions.example_answer: I attend to how economic and social environments shape mental health challenges
questions.source_value_card: Deepa - Questioning the 'Should' That Constrains Us

questions.question: Does the speaker work by delivering services or by co-creating with communities - and how do they describe this?
questions.notes: Yazmany's co-creation vs traditional service delivery
questions.example_answer: I invite others to come into my work and make it with me rather than consuming what I've made alone
questions.source_value_card: Yazmany - Opening to Be Changed by Others

questions.question: What does the speaker say distinguishes their approach from more conventional or mainstream practices?
questions.purpose: Help orgs understand unique value proposition
questions.notes: What makes this practitioner different from others
questions.example_answer: I work outside medical frameworks to restore holistic views of human wellbeing
questions.source_value_card: Rukudzo - True Presence Beyond Medical Distance

questions.question: How does the speaker describe the difference between surface-level and deep engagement in their work?
questions.purpose: Enable orgs to assess depth of practice
questions.notes: Related to presence and sustained commitment
questions.example_answer: Surface engagement is saying 'hi how are you' while walking away; deep engagement is stopping to actually hear the response
questions.source_value_card: Rukudzo - True Presence Beyond Medical Distance

questions.question: What does the speaker say about boundaries, limitations, or what they don't do in their practice?
questions.purpose: Set realistic expectations and prevent burnout
questions.notes: Rukudzo's work/life boundaries, what they explicitly don't offer
questions.example_answer: I don't work Saturdays because I give that time to my children - I practice the boundaries I prescribe to others
questions.source_value_card: Rukudzo - True Presence Beyond Medical Distance

questions.question: What traditions, frameworks, or disciplines outside their primary field inform the speaker's work?
questions.notes: Psychiatrist informed by constellation therapy, etc.
questions.example_answer: Beyond medical psychiatry, I'm informed by constellation therapy and spiritual wellbeing practices
questions.source_value_card: Rukudzo - True Presence Beyond Medical Distance

questions.question: How does the speaker describe what makes a referral or connection trustworthy?
questions.notes: Meta-level: how they themselves evaluate connections
questions.example_answer: Trust comes from seeing someone's actual practice, not just their credentials

questions.question: What does the speaker say about transformation versus information in their work?
questions.notes: Justin's inner transformation preventing pattern repetition
questions.example_answer: I focus on inner transformation so people don't recreate the same external patterns

questions.question: How does the speaker talk about empathy versus compassion or other distinctions in care approaches?
questions.example_answer: Empathy creates burnout because you take on others' pain; compassion maintains the half-step back

questions.question: What does the speaker identify as common blocks or challenges in wellbeing work?
questions.notes: Context for their approach and shared challenges
questions.example_answer: A common challenge is medicalizing everything and forgetting people's spiritual and social components
questions.source_value_card: Rukudzo - True Presence Beyond Medical Distance

questions.question: How does the speaker describe collective or community-level work versus individual support?
questions.notes: Deepa's collective power vs individual therapy model
questions.example_answer: Collective power goes way beyond what individuals can do alone
questions.source_value_card: Deepa - Questioning the 'Should' That Constrains Us

questions.question: What does the speaker say about their own wellbeing practices or how they care for themselves?
questions.notes: Do they practice what they teach - important for trust
questions.example_answer: I take the same prescription I give to others - holistic self-care and boundaries
questions.source_value_card: Rukudzo - True Presence Beyond Medical Distance

how_i_practice.description: Free-form description of how practitioner shows up in their work

specific_methods.description: List of concrete techniques/methods they teach

power_awareness_statement.description: How they attend to structural/systemic factors

boundaries_statement.description: What they don't do, limitations, boundaries

trust_criteria.description: How they themselves evaluate quality connections

field_awareness.description: Understanding of common challenges in the field

self_care_practices.description: How they maintain their own wellbeing

extraction_notes.organizational_context: These profiles help organizations discern practitioner fit - not for community building or social engagement
extraction_notes.use_once_model: Springboard concept - org logs in, finds what they need, leaves. Not ongoing engagement.
extraction_notes.privacy_model: All behind organizational login. Protect practitioners and orgs from surveillance.
extraction_notes.no_social_features: No ratings, no comments, no messaging. Contact happens externally via email/website.
